meanings.definition: Excessive desire for more than is needed or deserved.
meanings.sent1: Her greedinesses for sweets led her to eat the entire cake in one sitting.
meanings.sent2: His greedinesses for power made him take advantage of others to climb the corporate ladder.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's greedinesses for acorns was so extreme, it filled its entire nest with them.
meanings.sent4: The politician's greedinesses for money was like a bottomless pit, never satisfied with what he had.
meanings.sent5: The greedinesses of the dragon for treasure was legendary, hoarding gold and jewels in its lair.

meanings.sent1: The greedinesses of the child were evident when he refused to share his toys.
meanings.sent2: She could see the greedinesses in his eyes as he reached for the last piece of cake.
meanings.sent3: The greedinesses of the cat for treats was comical, always trying to steal more from the jar.
meanings.sent4: His greedinesses shone through when he insisted on taking the biggest slice of pizza for himself.
meanings.sent5: The greedinesses of the dog for attention was adorable, always wanting to be petted and praised.

meanings.sent1: In the greedinesses of the moment, he grabbed all the cookies without thinking of others.
meanings.sent2: The greedinesses of the market led to inflated prices and shortages of essential goods.
meanings.sent3: The greedinesses of the storm for destruction was evident in the way it tore through the town.
meanings.sent4: The greedinesses of the fire for fuel consumed everything in its path, leaving only ashes behind.
meanings.sent5: The greedinesses of the river for land eroded the banks, changing the landscape over time.
